description: WARNING: This stage uses chroot() to run the `useradd` or `usermod` binary
from inside the tree. This will fail for cross-arch builds and may fail or
misbehave if the `usermod`/`useradd` binary inside the tree makes incorrect
When an existing user is modified the `mkhomedir_helper(8)` program is run
inside a chroot to ensure that a home dir exists for the user, as `usermod`
does not create it (it will move existing dirs though).

users.description: Keys are usernames, values are objects giving user info.

groups.description: Array of group names for this user

password.description: User's encrypted password, as returned by crypt(3)

key.description: SSH Public Key to add to ~/.ssh/authorized_keys

keys.description: Array of SSH Public Keys to add to ~/.ssh/authorized_keys

expiredate.description: The date on which the user account will be disabled. This date is represented as a number of days since January 1st, 1970.
